If subsection (1) or (2) is contravened, the vendor commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 6.

section.name: s43
section.heading: Application of sections 36, 37, 39, 40 and 41 in case of phased development
section.content: If the vendor, in the case of section 14(2)(b), makes available for viewing by prospective purchasers, or by the general public, a show flat of a residential property in an uncompleted phase of the development, sections 36, 37, 39, 40 and 41 apply to the show flat as if a reference in those sections to the development were a reference to the uncompleted phase.

division.name: D5
division.heading: Viewing of Property in Completed Development or Phase

section.name: s44
section.heading: Viewing before sale

subsection.content: Before the specified residential property is sold to a person, the vendor must make the residential property available for viewing by the person.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not require the vendor to make the specified residential property available for viewing by the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if it is not reasonably practicable for the specified residential property to be viewed by the person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the vendor has made a comparable residential property in the completed development (in the case of section 14(3)(a)) or completed phase (in the case of section 14(3)(b)) available for viewing by the person; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: it is not reasonably practicable for any such comparable residential property to be viewed by the person, and the person agrees in writing that the vendor is not required to make such a comparable residential property available for viewing by the person before the specified residential property is sold to the person.

subsection.content: If subsection (1) is contravened, the vendor of the specified residential property commits an offence and is liable to a fine of $500,000.

section.name: s45
section.heading: Requirements for comparable residential property for viewing

subsection.content: This section applies if, before the specified residential property is sold to a person, the vendor makes a comparable residential property available for viewing by the person for the purposes of section 44(2)(b)(i).

subsection.leadIn: The vendor must display in the comparable residential property in accordance with subsection (4)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a plan of the comparable residential property that shows the dimensions of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the comparable residential property; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the internal partitions, and any bay windows, air conditioning plant rooms, balconies, utility platforms and verandahs, in the comparable residential property; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a plan of the specified residential property that shows the dimensions of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the specified residential property; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the internal partitions, and any bay windows, air conditioning plant rooms, balconies, utility platforms and verandahs, in the specified residential property.

subsection.leadIn: The vendor must display in the comparable residential property in accordance with subsection (4) a notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: setting out which (if any) of the fittings, finishes and appliances in the comparable residential property are those included in the specified residential property as depicted in the sales brochure for the development or the phase; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: stating that any other fittings, finishes and appliances in the comparable residential property are not included in the specified residential property.

subsection.content: A plan under subsection (2), or a notice under subsection (3), must be displayed in such a manner that the plan or notice is reasonably visible to any person entering the comparable residential property.
If subsection (2) or (3) is contravened, the vendor commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 6.

section.name: s46
section.heading: Measurements and photographs to be taken in residential property for viewing

subsection.content: The vendor must not restrict any person who views a residential property for the purposes of section 44(1) or (2)(b)(i) from taking measurements, or taking photographs or making video recordings, of the residential property.
Subsection (1) does not apply to any restriction that is reasonable in the circumstances for ensuring the safety of the persons viewing the residential property.
Subsection (1) does not apply if the residential property is held under a tenancy (other than a Government lease).
If subsection (1) is contravened, the vendor commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 6.

section.name: s47
section.heading: Sales arrangements to be made available on website

subsection.leadIn: During a period of at least 3 days immediately before a date of the sale mentioned in section 14(1), and on such a date, the vendor—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must make hard copies of a document containing the information specified in subsection (2) available for collection by the general public free of charge; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must, in accordance with subsection (3), make the information specified in subsection (2) available for inspection on the website designated by the vendor for the development for the purposes of this Part.

subsection.leadIn: The following information is specified for the purposes of subsection (1)(a) and (b)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date and time when, and the place where, the specified residential property will be offered to be sold;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the number of specified residential properties in the development that will be offered to be sold on that date, and at that time and place;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a description of the specified residential properties mentioned in paragraph (b);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the method to be used to determine the order of priority in which each of the persons interested in purchasing any of those specified residential properties may select the residential property that the person wishes to purchase;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the method to be used, in any case where 2 or more persons are interested in purchasing a particular specified residential property, to determine the order of priority in which each of those persons may proceed with the purchase.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1)(b), the information must be published in such a manner that the information is reasonably visible to any person browsing the website.
The specified residential property must not be sold, or offered to be sold, before the date and time published under subsection (2)(a).
If subsection (1) or (4) is contravened, the vendor commits an offence and is liable to a fine of $500,000.

section.name: s48
section.heading: Plans and documents to be made available to general public

subsection.leadIn: On a date of the sale mentioned in section 14(1), the vendor must make the following available for inspection by the general public free of charge at the place where the sale is to take place—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a copy of either of the following plans relating to the development—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the outline zoning plan or development permission area plan (whether in draft, partly approved or approved form) under the Town Planning Ordinance (Cap. 131); (Amended 25 of 2023 s. 125)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a plan that, by virtue of section 25(7) of the Urban Renewal Authority Ordinance (Cap. 563), is deemed to be a draft plan prepared by the Town Planning Board for the purposes of the Town Planning Ordinance (Cap. 131);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy of the approved building plans for the development;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a copy of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for an uncompleted development, the latest draft of every deed of mutual covenant in respect of the specified residential property as at that date; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: for a completed development, either or both of the following as applicable—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: every deed of mutual covenant in respect of the specified residential property that has been executed;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the latest draft of every deed of mutual covenant in respect of the specified residential property as at that date;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a copy of the land grant;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the aerial photograph of the development as set out in the sales brochure for the development.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)(e), the aerial photograph—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be at a scale within the range of 1:700 to 1:800; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not required to comply with section 7(3)(a) of Schedule 1.

subsection.content: Subsection (1)(b) does not apply in the case of a specified NT development.
If subsection (1) is contravened, the vendor commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 6.

section.name: s49
section.heading: Deed of mutual covenant and aerial photograph to be made available on website

subsection.leadIn: On a date of the sale mentioned in section 14(1), the vendor must make the following available for inspection on the website designated by the vendor for the development for the purposes of this Part—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a copy of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for an uncompleted development, the latest draft of every deed of mutual covenant in respect of the specified residential property as at that date; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: for a completed development, either or both of the following as applicable—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: every deed of mutual covenant in respect of the specified residential property that has been executed;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the latest draft of every deed of mutual covenant in respect of the specified residential property as at that date;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the aerial photograph of the development as set out in the sales brochure for the development.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1)(b), the aerial photograph is not required to comply with section 7(3)(a) of Schedule 1.
If subsection (1) is contravened, the vendor commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 6.

section.name: s50
section.heading: Floor plan of specified residential property

subsection.leadIn: If the vendor makes available for collection or inspection by the general public a floor plan of the specified residential property, the floor plan—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must have the scale to which it is drawn marked on that plan; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must show the dimensions of the furniture (if any) shown on that plan.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) does not apply to a floor plan of the specified residential property that is made available in the sales brochure.
If subsection (1) is contravened, the vendor commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 6.

section.name: s51
section.heading: Application of sections 47 to 49 in case of phased development

subsection.leadIn: If the development is divided into 2 or more phases—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 47 applies as if a reference in that section to the development were a reference to the phase of which the specified residential property forms part; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: sections 48 and 49 apply as if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a reference in sections 48(1)(c)(i) and 49(1)(a)(i) to an uncompleted development were a reference to an uncompleted phase;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a reference in sections 48(1)(c)(ii) and 49(1)(a)(ii) to a completed development were a reference to a completed phase; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: subject to subsection (2), a reference in sections 48 and 49 to the development were a reference to the phase of which the specified residential property forms part.

subsection.content: Subsection (1)(b)(iii) does not apply to a reference in section 48(1)(a) to the development.

section.name: s52
section.heading: Deposit on entering into preliminary agreement

subsection.content: A preliminary deposit of 5% of the purchase price is payable by a person to the owner on entering into a preliminary agreement for sale and purchase in respect of the specified residential property with the owner.

If there is any conflict or inconsistency between subsection (1) and a provision of a preliminary agreement for sale and purchase, subsection (1) prevails over the provision to the extent of the conflict or inconsistency.
The Secretary may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend subsection (1) by substituting another percentage for the percentage specified in that subsection.

section.name: s53
section.heading: Execution of agreement for sale and purchase

subsection.content: This section applies if a person enters into a preliminary agreement for sale and purchase with the owner in respect of the specified residential property.

If a person executes an agreement for sale and purchase in respect of the residential property within 5 working days after the date on which the person enters into the preliminary agreement for sale and purchase, the owner must execute the agreement for sale and purchase within 8 working days after that date.

subsection.leadIn: If a person does not execute an agreement for sale and purchase in respect of the residential property within 5 working days after the date on which the person enters into the preliminary agreement for sale and purchase—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the preliminary agreement is terminated;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the preliminary deposit is forfeited; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the owner does not have any further claim against the person for the failure.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (3)(c), any right of the owner under common law rules or equitable principles to make further claims against the person for the failure is abrogated.
If subsection (2) is contravened, the owner commits an offence and is liable to a fine of $1,000,000.

section.name: s54
section.heading: Owner must not enter into preliminary agreement without certain provisions
section.leadIn: The owner must not enter into a preliminary agreement for sale and purchase in respect of the specified residential property with any person unless that preliminary agreement contains the provisions set out in Schedule 4—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: with additional information inserted in accordance with the instructions specified in those provisions as printed in italics; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: with deletions made in accordance with the instructions specified in those provisions as marked with an asterisk (*).

section.name: s55
section.heading: Owner must not enter into agreement without certain provisions

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where a preliminary agreement for sale and purchase has been entered into in respect of the specified residential property, an agreement for sale and purchase in respect of the residential property; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where no preliminary agreement for sale and purchase has been entered into in respect of the specified residential property, an agreement for sale and purchase in respect of the specified residential property.

subsection.leadIn: The owner must not enter into the agreement for sale and purchase with any person unless that agreement contains the provisions set out in Schedule 5, 6 or 7 (as applicable in accordance with subsection (3))—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: with additional information inserted in accordance with the instructions specified in those provisions as printed in italics; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: with deletions made in accordance with the instructions specified in those provisions as marked with an asterisk (*), a gamma (γ), a beta (β), a theta (θ), a pi (π), a sigma (Σ), an omega (Ω) or a psi (Ψ).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2), the agreement for sale and purchase—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: must contain the provisions set out in Schedule 5 in either of the following situations—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the development is an uncompleted development;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for a development divided into 2 or more phases, the phase of which the residential property forms part is an uncompleted phase;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must contain the provisions set out in Schedule 6 in either of the following situations—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the development is a completed development pending compliance;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for a development divided into 2 or more phases, the phase of which the residential property forms part is a completed phase pending compliance; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: must contain the provisions set out in Schedule 7 in either of the following situations—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the development is a completed development but is not a completed development pending compliance;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for a development divided into 2 or more phases, the phase of which the residential property forms part is a completed phase but is not a completed phase pending compliance.

section.name: s56
section.heading: Provision supplementary to sections 54 and 55

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of sections 54 and 55, a preliminary agreement for sale and purchase, or an agreement for sale and purchase, is to be regarded as having contained the provisions set out in Schedule 4, 5, 6 or 7 (as applicable) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a preliminary agreement for sale and purchase, or an agreement for sale and purchase, in English, the preliminary agreement or the agreement contains the provisions set out in Part 1 of that Schedule;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a preliminary agreement for sale and purchase, or an agreement for sale and purchase, in Chinese, the preliminary agreement or the agreement contains the provisions set out in Part 2 of that Schedule; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of a preliminary agreement for sale and purchase, or an agreement for sale and purchase, in English and Chinese, the preliminary agreement or the agreement contains the provisions set out in Parts 1 and 2 of that Schedule.

subsection.content: Where a preliminary agreement for sale and purchase, or an agreement for sale and purchase, contains a provision set out in Schedule 4, 5, 6 or 7 in compliance with section 54 or 55(2), the provision prevails over any other provision of the preliminary agreement or the agreement that is inconsistent with it.

section.name: s57
section.heading: Offences relating to sections 54 and 55

subsection.content: If section 54 or 55(2) is contravened, the owner commits an offence and is liable to a fine of $500,000.

subsection.leadIn: Section 54 or 55(2) is not to be regarded as having been contravened only because—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: when a provision set out in Schedule 4, 5, 6 or 7 is incorporated into a preliminary agreement for sale and purchase or an agreement for sale and purchase—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the provision has been assigned as a schedule to that preliminary agreement or that agreement; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the clause number of the provision has been reassigned; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a cross reference to that provision in another provision in that preliminary agreement or that agreement has been revised accordingly.

subsection.content: Subject to section 52(2), a contravention of section 54 or 55(2) does not affect the validity or enforceability of the preliminary agreement for sale and purchase or the agreement for sale and purchase.

section.name: s58
section.heading: Register of Transactions to be kept by vendor

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), the vendor must keep for the purposes of section 60 one (and only one) register of transactions for the development.
If the development is divided into 2 or more phases, the vendor must keep for the purposes of section 60 one (and only one) register of transactions for each phase.
If subsection (1) or (2) is contravened, the vendor commits an offence and is liable to a fine of $500,000.

section.name: s59
section.heading: Contents of, and entries in, Register of Transactions

subsection.leadIn: The Register of Transactions for the development must, in relation to each residential property in the development that is a specified residential property on the first day on which the Register is required to be kept under section 58(1), set out the following information in the form specified by the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a description of the residential property;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a description of the parking space that is sold together with the residential property under one single preliminary agreement for sale and purchase or agreement for sale and purchase;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the date of any preliminary agreement for sale and purchase to which subsection (2)(a) applies;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the date of any agreement for sale and purchase to which subsection (2)(b) or (3) applies;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the price of any transaction under the preliminary agreement mentioned in paragraph (c) or under the agreement mentioned in paragraph (d);

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the details and date of any revision of that price under section 35(2);

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the terms of payment (including any discount on the price, and any gift, or any financial advantage or benefit, made available in connection with the purchase);

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the date on which any agreement for sale and purchase to which subsection (2)(b) or (3) applies is terminated;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: whether the purchaser under the preliminary agreement mentioned in paragraph (c) or under the agreement mentioned in paragraph (d) is or is not a related party to the vendor.

subsection.leadIn: If the owner enters into a preliminary agreement for sale and purchase with another person in respect of a specified residential property in the development—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the vendor must, within 24 hours after the owner enters into the preliminary agreement, enter in the Register of Transactions for the development the following particulars—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a description of the residential property;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a description of the parking space that is sold together with the residential property under that preliminary agreement;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the date of that preliminary agreement;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the price of the transaction;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: the terms of payment (including any discount on the price, and any gift, or any financial advantage or benefit, made available in connection with the purchase);

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: whether the person is or is not a related party to the vendor;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: within 1 working day after the date on which the owner enters into an agreement for sale and purchase with that other person in respect of the residential property, the vendor—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: must enter the date of that agreement in the Register of Transactions for the development; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if there is any change in the particulars of the transaction mentioned in paragraph (a)(vi), must revise the entry in the Register of Transactions; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where that other person has not entered into an agreement for sale and purchase with the owner in respect of the residential property within 5 working days after the date on which the preliminary agreement is entered into, the vendor must, on the 6th working day after that date, indicate that fact in the Register of Transactions for the development in relation to the residential property.

subsection.leadIn: Within 1 working day after the date on which the owner enters into an agreement for sale and purchase in respect of a specified residential property in the development (for which property no preliminary agreement for sale and purchase has been entered into), the vendor must enter in the Register of Transactions for the development the following particulars—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a description of the residential property;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a description of the parking space that is sold together with the residential property under that agreement;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the date of that agreement;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the price of the transaction;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the terms of payment (including any discount on the price, and any gift, or any financial advantage or benefit, made available in connection with the purchase);

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: whether the person is or is not a related party to the vendor.

subsection.content: Within 1 working day after the date on which the price of a residential property is revised under section 35(2), the vendor must enter the details and that date in the Register of Transactions for the development.

If an agreement for sale and purchase to which subsection (2)(b) or (3) applies is terminated, the vendor must, within 1 working day after the date of termination, enter that date in the Register of Transactions for the development.
If subsection (1), (2), (3), (4) or (5) is contravened, the vendor commits an offence and is liable to a fine of $500,000.

subsection.leadIn: In this section, a person is a related party to a vendor if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: where that vendor is a corporation, the person is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a director of that vendor, or a parent, spouse or child of such a director;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a manager of that vendor;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a private company of which such a director, parent, spouse, child or manager is a director or shareholder;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: an associate corporation or holding company of that vendor;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: a director of such an associate corporation or holding company, or a parent, spouse or child of such a director; or

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: a manager of such an associate corporation or holding company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where that vendor is an individual, the person is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a parent, spouse or child of that vendor; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a private company of which such a parent, spouse or child is a director or shareholder; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: where that vendor is a partnership, the person is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a partner of that vendor, or a parent, spouse or child of such a partner; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a private company of which such a partner, parent, spouse, child is a director or shareholder.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: manager (經理) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920 and L.N. 162 of 2013)
private company (私人公司) has the meaning given by section 11 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622). (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920 and L.N. 162 of 2013)

subsection.content: This section applies only to a Register of Transactions that has been made available under section 60.

section.name: s60
section.heading: Register of Transactions to be made available to general public

subsection.content: On a date of the sale mentioned in section 14(1), the vendor must make the Register of Transactions for the development available for inspection by the general public free of charge at the place where the sale is to take place.

During the period specified in subsection (3), the vendor must make an electronic copy of the Register of Transactions available for inspection on the website designated by the vendor for the development for the purposes of this Part.

The period is one that begins on the date on which the Register of Transactions is first made available under subsection (1) and ends on the first day on which the first assignment of each residential property in relation to which section 59(1) applies has been registered in the Land Registry.

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after the vendor has made an entry into the Register of Transactions for the development under section 59(2), (3), (4) or (5), the vendor must provide an electronic copy of that Register of Transactions to the following for the purpose of the electronic database established under section 89(1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if a public officer or person is delegated under section 89(2) with the power to establish and maintain that database, the public officer or person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if no public officer or person is so delegated, the Authority.

subsection.content: If subsection (1) is contravened, the vendor commits an offence and is liable to a fine of $500,000.
If subsection (2) or (4) is contravened, the vendor commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 6.

section.name: s61
section.heading: Purpose of Register of Transactions
section.content: The purpose of the Register of Transactions for the development is to provide a member of the public with the transaction information relating to the development, as set out in the Register, for understanding the residential property market conditions in Hong Kong.

section.name: s62
section.heading: Application of sections 59 and 60 in case of phased development
section.content: If the development is divided into 2 or more phases, sections 59 and 60 apply to a Register of Transactions for the phase of which the residential property forms part as if a reference in those sections to the development were a reference to that phase.

section.name: s63
section.heading: Exception: all residential properties in development or phase sold under single agreement etc.

subsection.content: Divisions 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 and 7 do not apply in any of the 3 situations specified in subsections (2), (3) and (4).

subsection.leadIn: The first situation is that all the residential properties in a multi-unit building in a development consisting of one or more multi-unit buildings but not houses (being specified residential properties)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: are sold by the owner to the same person under a single preliminary agreement for sale and purchase or agreement for sale and purchase; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: are offered by the owner to be sold to any other person on the condition that those residential properties will only be sold to the same person under a single preliminary agreement for sale and purchase or agreement for sale and purchase.

subsection.leadIn: The second situation is that all the residential properties in a development consisting of houses but not multi-unit buildings (being specified residential properties)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: are sold by the owner to the same person under a single preliminary agreement for sale and purchase or agreement for sale and purchase; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: are offered by the owner to be sold to any other person on the condition that those residential properties will only be sold to the same person under a single preliminary agreement for sale and purchase or agreement for sale and purchase.

subsection.leadIn: The third situation is that either or both of the residential properties specified in subsection (5)(a) and (b)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: are sold by the owner to the same person under a single preliminary agreement for sale and purchase or agreement for sale and purchase; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: are offered by the owner to be sold to any other person on the condition that those residential properties will only be sold to the same person under a single preliminary agreement for sale and purchase or agreement for sale and purchase.

subsection.leadIn: The following are specified for the purposes of subsection (4)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all the residential properties in a multi-unit building in a development consisting of one or more multi-unit buildings as well as houses (being specified residential properties);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all the residential properties in the houses in such a development (being specified residential properties).

subsection.content: In the first, second or third situation, the fact that the residential properties are sold, or offered to be sold, with other properties in the development is not relevant. Subsection (1) does not operate to disapply Divisions 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 and 7 in the case of those other properties.
If the development is divided into 2 or more phases, a reference in this section to a development is a reference to a phase of the development.

section.name: s64
section.heading: Exception: property sold or offered to be sold to associated entity
section.leadIn: Divisions 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 and 7 do not apply if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the specified residential property is sold by a corporation or a specified body, or is offered by a corporation or a specified body to be sold, to an associate corporation, or a holding company, of the corporation or specified body; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the specified residential property is sold by an individual, or is offered by an individual to be sold, to an immediate family member of the individual.

section.name: s65
section.heading: Exception: development constructed by Housing Authority
section.content: Divisions 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7 and 8 do not apply if the development is constructed by the Housing Authority.

section.name: s66
section.heading: Exception and additional requirement: property sold or offered to be sold to sitting tenant

subsection.content: Divisions 3, 4, 5 and 6 do not apply in the situation specified in subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The situation is that the specified residential property is sold by the owner, or is offered by the owner to be sold, to any other person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: who holds that property under a tenancy (other than a Government lease); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: who, as at the date of that property being sold or offered to be sold (as the case may be), has so held that property for a continuous period of at least one year.

subsection.content: Division 2 does not apply in the situation specified in subsection (2) if that other person agrees in writing that the Division does not apply.

In the situation specified in subsection (2), the vendor must, as soon as practicable after the property is offered to be sold to that other person, provide that other person with a single document (vendor’s information form) printed within the previous 3 months.
The vendor’s information form must set out the information required by Schedule 8.
The vendor’s information form must state the date on which the document is printed.
The information set out in the vendor’s information form must be accurate as at the date on which that form is printed.
If subsection (4), (5), (6) or (7) is contravened, the vendor commits an offence and is liable to a fine of $500,000.

section.name: s67
section.heading: Exception: property sold or offered to be sold by way of auction or tender
section.content: Division 3 does not apply if the specified residential property is sold by the owner, or is offered by the owner to be sold, to any other person by way of auction or tender.

section.name: s68
section.heading: Additional requirement: specified residential property in completed development

subsection.content: If a specified residential property in a completed development, or a completed phase of a development, is offered by the owner to be sold to a person, the vendor must, as soon as practicable after the offer is made, provide the person with a single document (vendor’s information form) printed within the previous 3 months.
The vendor’s information form must set out the information required by Schedule 8.
The vendor’s information form must state the date on which the document is printed.
The information set out in the vendor’s information form must be accurate as at the date on which that form is printed.
The requirements under subsection (1), (2), (3) and (4) are in addition to any other requirements that apply by virtue of Division 2, 3, 5, 6, 7 or 8.
If subsection (1), (2), (3) or (4) is contravened, the vendor commits an offence and is liable to a fine of $500,000.

section.name: s69
section.heading: Application of Part 3
section.content: This Part applies to an advertisement purporting to promote the sale of any specified residential property.

section.name: s70
section.heading: Advertisement must not contain false or misleading information

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person publishes an advertisement containing information that is false or misleading in a material particular or causes such an advertisement to be published; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person knows that, or is reckless as to whether, the information is false or misleading in the material particular.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $5,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 3 years.

section.name: s71
section.heading: General requirements for advertisement

subsection.content: If an advertisement is published by the vendor or by another person with the consent of the vendor, the advertisement must state that fact.

In the case of an advertisement purporting to promote the sale of any specified residential property in an uncompleted development or a completed development pending compliance, the advertisement must state a date that is, to the best of the vendor’s knowledge, the estimated material date for the development.

subsection.leadIn: In the case of an advertisement purporting to promote the sale of any specified residential property in an uncompleted phase, or a completed phase pending compliance, of a development—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subsection (2) does not apply; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the advertisement must state a date that is, to the best of the vendor’s knowledge, the estimated material date for the phase.

subsection.content: An advertisement must not give information on the size or unit price of any specified residential property otherwise than by reference to the saleable area of that property.
If subsection (1) is contravened, the person who publishes the advertisement, or causes the advertisement to be published, commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 6.
If subsection (2), (3)(b) or (4) is contravened, the person who publishes the advertisement, or causes the advertisement to be published, commits an offence and is liable to a fine of $500,000.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: UnitPrice
def.leadIn: unit price (單位售價), in relation to any specified residential property, includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the price of the property per square foot; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the price of the property per square metre.

section.name: s72
section.heading: Advertisement must contain statement about sales brochure

subsection.content: This section applies if the sales brochure for the development, or the sales brochure for the phase of which the specified residential property forms part, has been made available under section 25(1) at the time when the advertisement is published.

subsection.leadIn: An advertisement comprising moving visual images—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the advertisement is solely or principally in English, must contain the statement specified in subsection (5);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the advertisement is solely or principally in Chinese, must contain the statement specified in subsection (6); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the advertisement is in both English and Chinese and does not fall within paragraph (a) or (b), must contain the statements specified in subsections (5) and (6).

subsection.leadIn: An advertisement comprising solely sound broadcasting—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the advertisement is solely or principally in English, must contain the statement specified in subsection (5); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the advertisement is solely or principally in Cantonese, Putonghua or other Chinese dialect, must contain the statement in that language or dialect specified in subsection (6).

subsection.content: Any other advertisement must contain a notice to the effect that a prospective purchaser is advised to refer to the sales brochure for any information on the development or the phase.
The statement specified for the purposes of subsections (2)(a) and (c) and (3)(a) is—“Please refer to the sales brochure for details.”.
The statement specified for the purposes of subsections (2)(b) and (c) and (3)(b) is—“詳情請參閱售樓說明書。”.
If subsection (2), (3) or (4) is contravened, a person who publishes the advertisement, or causes the advertisement to be published, commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 6.

section.name: s73
section.heading: Additional requirements for printed advertisement

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an advertisement in a newspaper;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an advertisement by the display of posters, notices, signs, labels, showcards or goods; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an advertisement by the distribution of circulars, brochures, catalogues or any other materials.

subsection.leadIn: An advertisement must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the district in which the development is situated, as stated in a plan relating to the development and specified in subsection (9);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name of the street at which the development is situated; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the street number allocated by the Commissioner of Rating and Valuation for the purpose of distinguishing the development.

subsection.leadIn: An advertisement must state the names of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the vendor, and if a vendor is a corporation, every holding company of that vendor;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the authorized person for the development, and the firm or corporation of which an authorized person for the development is a proprietor, director or employee in his or her professional capacity;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the building contractor for the development;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the firm of solicitors acting for the owner in relation to the sale of residential properties in the development;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any authorized institution that has made a loan, or has undertaken to provide finance, for the construction of the development;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any other person who has made a loan for the construction of the development.

subsection.leadIn: An advertisement must, in the case of a specified NT development, state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the period for which the authorized person for the development is appointed to supervise the construction of the development; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the period for which the building contractor for the development is appointed to construct the development.

subsection.content: An advertisement must state the address of the website designated or to be designated by the vendor for the development for the purposes of Part 2.
An advertisement must state the date on which it is printed.

If an advertisement contains a picture, image, drawing or sketch showing an artist’s impression of the development or its surrounding area, the advertisement must contain a statement specified in section 74.

subsection.leadIn: For a statement contained in an advertisement for the purposes of subsection (2), (5) or (7)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the size of the advertisement is not larger than 1 039 square centimetres—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of an English statement, the size of the letters or numbers must not be smaller than the size of the same letters or numbers in 10 point Times New Roman typeface; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of a Chinese statement, the size of the characters or numbers must not be smaller than the size of the same characters or numbers in 10 point “新細明體” typeface;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the size of the advertisement is larger than 1 039 square centimetres but is not larger than 2 077 square centimetres—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of an English statement, the size of the letters or numbers must not be smaller than the size of the same letters or numbers in 12 point Times New Roman typeface; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of a Chinese statement, the size of the characters or numbers must not be smaller than the size of the same characters or numbers in 12 point “新細明體” typeface;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if the size of the advertisement is larger than 2 077 square centimetres but is not larger than 4 155 square centimetres—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of an English statement, the size of the letters or numbers must not be smaller than the size of the same letters or numbers in 16 point Times New Roman typeface; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of a Chinese statement, the size of the characters or numbers must not be smaller than the size of the same characters or numbers in 16 point “新細明體” typeface; or

paragraph.name: d

subsection.leadIn: The plan specified for the purposes of subsection (2)(a) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the outline zoning plan or development permission area plan (whether in draft, partly approved or approved form) under the Town Planning Ordinance (Cap. 131); or (Amended 25 of 2023 s. 126)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a plan that, by virtue of section 25(7) of the Urban Renewal Authority Ordinance (Cap. 563), is deemed to be a draft plan prepared by the Town Planning Board for the purposes of the Town Planning Ordinance (Cap. 131).

subsection.content: In the case of an advertisement purporting to promote the sale of any specified residential property in a phase of a development, subsections (2)(b) and (c), (3), (5) and (7) apply to the advertisement as if a reference in those sections to the development were a reference to that phase.
If subsection (2) is contravened, a person who publishes the advertisement, or causes the advertisement to be published, commits an offence and is liable to a fine of $500,000.

If subsection (3), (4), (5), (6), (7) or (8) is contravened, a person who publishes the advertisement, or causes the advertisement to be published, commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 6.

section.name: s74
section.heading: Provision supplementary to section 73(7)
section.leadIn: The statement specified for the purposes of section 73(7) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the advertisement is solely or principally in English, the statement set out below— “The photographs, images, drawings or sketches shown in this advertisement/promotional material represent an artist’s impression of the development concerned only. They are not drawn to scale and/or may have been edited and processed with computerized imaging techniques. Prospective purchasers should make reference to the sales brochure for details of the development. The vendor also advises prospective purchasers to conduct an on-site visit for a better understanding of the development site, its surrounding environment and the public facilities nearby.”;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the advertisement is solely or principally in Chinese, the statement set out below—
“本廣告╱宣傳資料內載列的相片、圖像、繪圖或素描顯示純屬畫家對有關發展項目之想像。有關相片、圖像、繪圖或素描並非按照比例繪畫及╱或可能經過電腦修飾處理。準買家如欲了解發展項目的詳情，請參閱售樓說明書。賣方亦建議準買家到有關發展地盤作實地考察，以對該發展地盤、其周邊地區環境及附近的公共設施有較佳了解。”; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the advertisement is in both English and Chinese and does not fall within paragraph (a) or (b), the statement set out in paragraph (a) and the statement set out in paragraph (b).

part.name: P4
part.heading: Misrepresentation, and Dissemination of False or Misleading Information etc.

section.name: s75
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 4

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, a person makes a fraudulent misrepresentation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the person makes a statement that, when it is made, is to the person’s knowledge false, misleading or deceptive;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the person makes a promise that, when it is made—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is to the person’s knowledge incapable of being fulfilled; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the person has no intention of fulfilling; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the person makes a statement; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the person intentionally omits a material fact from the statement, with the result that the statement is rendered false, misleading or deceptive when it is made.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, a person makes a reckless misrepresentation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the person recklessly makes a statement that, when it is made, is false, misleading or deceptive;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person recklessly makes a promise that, when it is made, is incapable of being fulfilled; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the person makes a statement; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the person recklessly omits a material fact from the statement, with the result that the statement is rendered false, misleading or deceptive when it is made.

section.name: s76
section.heading: Misrepresentation: criminal liability

subsection.content: A person commits an offence if the person makes a fraudulent misrepresentation or reckless misrepresentation for the purpose of inducing another person to purchase any specified residential property.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $5,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 3 years.

section.name: s77
section.heading: Misrepresentation: civil liability

subsection.content: This section applies if a person makes a fraudulent misrepresentation or reckless misrepresentation by which another person is induced to purchase a specified residential property.

The person who makes the misrepresentation is liable to pay compensation by way of damages to the other person for any pecuniary loss that the other person has sustained as a result of the reliance by the other person on the misrepresentation. This subsection applies whether or not the person who makes the misrepresentation also incurs any other liability.
An action may be brought against a person under subsection (2) even though the person has not been charged with or convicted of an offence by reason of a contravention of section 76.

subsection.leadIn: To avoid doubt, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a court has jurisdiction to determine an action brought under subsection (2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: apart from this section, the court has jurisdiction to entertain an application for an injunction,

subsection.continued: the court may grant an injunction in addition to, or in substitution for, damages, on such terms and conditions as it thinks fit.

subsection.content: This section does not affect, limit or diminish any rights conferred on a person, or any liability that a person may incur, under the common law rules or equitable principles or any other Ordinance.

section.name: s78
section.heading: Dissemination of false or misleading information

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the person disseminates, or authorizes or is concerned in the dissemination of, information that is likely to induce another person to purchase any specified residential property; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the information is false or misleading as to a material fact, and the person knows that, or is reckless as to whether, the information is false or misleading as to the material fact; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the information is false or misleading through the omission of a material fact, and the person knows that, or is reckless as to whether, the information is false or misleading through the omission of the material fact.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $5,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 3 years.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: disseminate (傳布) includes circulate or disclose.

part.name: P5
part.heading: Defence Provisions, and Other Supplementary Provisions on Offences

division.name: D1
division.heading: Defence of Reasonable Precautions and Due Diligence

section.name: s79
section.heading: Defence
section.content: If a person is charged with an offence under Part 2 or 3 (other than section 70), it is a defence to prove that the person took all reasonable precautions and exercised all due diligence to avoid the commission of the offence by that person.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Defence for Offences in Relation to False or Misleading Information

section.name: s80
section.heading: Application and Interpretation of Division 2

subsection.content: This Division applies in either of the 2 situations specified in subsections (2) and (3).

subsection.leadIn: The first situation is where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person is charged with an offence under section 78(1) for disseminating, or authorizing or being concerned in the dissemination, of false or misleading information; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the contravention took place by reason only of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an issue or reproduction of the information;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a re-transmission of the information; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a live broadcast of the information.

subsection.leadIn: The second situation is where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person is charged with an offence under section 70 for publishing or causing to be published an advertisement containing information that is false or misleading in a material particular; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the contravention took place by reason only of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an issue or reproduction of the advertisement;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a re-transmission of the advertisement; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a live broadcast of the advertisement.

subsection.leadIn: In this Division, a reference to issuing materials (including information or advertisement)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: includes publishing, circulating, distributing or otherwise disseminating materials or their contents, whether—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by any visit in person;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in a newspaper, magazine, journal or other publication;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: by the display of posters or notices;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: by means of circulars, brochures, pamphlets or handbills;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: by an exhibition of photographs or cinematograph films;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: by any information system or other electronic device; or

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.content: by any other means, whether mechanically, electronically, magnetically, optically, manually or by any other medium, or by way of production or transmission of light, image or sound or any other medium; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: also includes causing or authorizing materials to be issued.

section.name: s81
section.heading: Defence: issue or reproduction of information or advertisement

subsection.leadIn: In the case of section 80(2)(b)(i) or (3)(b)(i), it is a defence to prove that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the issue or reproduction of the information or advertisement took place in the ordinary course of a business (whether or not carried on by the person charged with the offence), the principal purpose of which was issuing or reproducing materials provided by others;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person specified in subsection (2) did not devise the contents of the information or advertisement, either in whole or in part;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person specified in subsection (2) did not select, add to, modify or otherwise exercise control over the contents of the information or advertisement for the purpose of the issue or reproduction; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: at the time of the issue or reproduction, the person charged with the offence did not know—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for section 80(2)(b)(i), that the information was false or misleading as to a material fact or was false or misleading through the omission of a material fact; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for section 80(3)(b)(i), that the information contained in the advertisement was false or misleading in a material particular.

subsection.leadIn: The person specified for the purposes of subsection (1)(b) and (c) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the business was carried on by the person charged with the offence, that person or any officer, employee or agent of that person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the business was not carried on by the person charged with the offence, that person.

section.name: s82
section.heading: Defence: re-transmission of information or advertisement

subsection.leadIn: In the case of section 80(2)(b)(ii) or (3)(b)(ii), it is a defence to prove that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the re-transmission of the information or advertisement took place in the ordinary course of a business (whether or not carried on by the person charged with the offence), the normal conduct of which involved the re-transmission of information to other persons within an information system or from one information system to another information system (wherever situated), whether directly or by facilitating the establishment of links between such other persons and third parties;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person specified in subsection (2) did not devise the contents of the information or advertisement, either in whole or in part;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person specified in subsection (2) did not select, add to, modify or otherwise exercise control over the contents of the information or advertisement for the purposes of the re-transmission;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: the re-transmission of the information or advertisement—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: was accompanied by a message to the effect specified in subsection (3); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: was effected following acknowledgment by the persons to whom it was re-transmitted of their understanding of the matter specified in subsection (3); and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: at the time of the re-transmission—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: the person charged with the offence did not know—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: for section 80(2)(b)(ii), that the information was false or misleading as to a material fact or was false or misleading through the omission of a material fact; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: for section 80(3)(b)(ii), that the information contained in the advertisement was false or misleading in a material particular; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: the person charged with the offence knew that the information was so false or misleading, but—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: where the business was carried on by the person charged with the offence, in the circumstances of the case that person could not reasonably be expected to prevent the re-transmission; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: where the business was not carried on by the person charged with the offence, in the circumstances of the case that person has taken all reasonable steps to bring the fact that the information was so false or misleading to the attention of a person in a position to take steps to cause the re-transmission to be prevented (even if the re-transmission in fact took place).

subsection.leadIn: The person specified for the purposes of subsection (1)(b) and (c) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the business was carried on by the person charged with the offence, that person or any officer, employee or agent of that person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the business was not carried on by the person charged with the offence, that person.

subsection.leadIn: The effect or matter specified for the purposes of subsection (1)(d) is that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the business was carried on by the person charged with the offence, that person or any officer, employee or agent of that person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: did not devise the contents of the information or advertisement, either in whole or in part;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: did not take responsibility for the information or advertisement; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: did not endorse the accuracy of the information or advertisement; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the business was not carried on by the person charged with the offence, the person who carried on the business or any officer, employee or agent of the person who carried on the business—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: did not devise the contents of the information or advertisement, either in whole or in part;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: did not take responsibility for the information or advertisement; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: did not endorse the accuracy of the information or advertisement.

section.name: s83
section.heading: Defence: live broadcast of information or advertisement

subsection.leadIn: In the case of section 80(2)(b)(iii) or (3)(b)(iii), it is a defence to prove that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the broadcast of the information or advertisement took place in the ordinary course of the business of a broadcaster (whether or not the person charged with the offence was the broadcaster);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person specified in subsection (2) did not devise the contents of the information or advertisement, either in whole or in part;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person specified in subsection (2) did not select, add to, modify or otherwise exercise control over the contents of the information or advertisement for the purposes of the broadcast;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where the person charged with the offence was the broadcaster, that person acted in accordance with the terms and conditions of the broadcasting licence (if any) held by that person, and with the broadcasting guidelines applicable to that person as a broadcaster, in relation to the broadcast; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the person charged with the offence was not the broadcaster, that person believed and had reasonable grounds to believe that another person who was the broadcaster acted in accordance with the terms and conditions of the broadcasting licence (if any), and with the broadcasting guidelines applicable to that other person as a broadcaster, in relation to the broadcast; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: at the time of the broadcast—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: the person charged with the offence did not know—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: for section 80(2)(b)(iii), that the information was false or misleading as to a material fact or was false or misleading through the omission of a material fact; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: for section 80(3)(b)(iii), that the information contained in the advertisement was false or misleading in a material particular; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: the person charged with the offence knew that the information was so false or misleading, but—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: where the person charged with the offence was the broadcaster, in the circumstances of the case that person could not reasonably be expected to prevent the broadcast; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: where the person charged with the offence was not the broadcaster, in the circumstances of the case that person has taken all reasonable steps to bring the fact that the information was so false or misleading to the attention of a person in a position to take steps to cause the broadcast to be prevented (even if the broadcast in fact took place).

subsection.leadIn: The person specified for the purposes of subsection (1)(b) or (c) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the person charged with the offence was the broadcaster, that person or any officer, employee or agent of that person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person charged with the offence was not the broadcaster, that person.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: broadcasting guidelines (廣播指引) means guidelines or codes of practice (however described) issued under or pursuant to the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106) or the Broadcasting Ordinance (Cap. 562);
broadcasting licence (廣播牌照), in relation to a person, means the licence by which the person became entitled to broadcast as a broadcaster.

section.name: s84
section.heading: Liability of officers etc. for offence committed by corporation or specified body

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a corporation or specified body commits an offence under this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: it is proved that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: the commission of the offence was aided, abetted, counselled, procured or induced—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: by an officer of the corporation or specified body, or of a holding company of the corporation or specified body; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: by a person purporting to act as such an officer; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the offence was committed with the consent or connivance of, or was attributable to any recklessness on the part of, such an officer or a person purporting to act as such an officer.

subsection.leadIn: The officer or the person purporting so to act, as well as the corporation or specified body—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: commits the offence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is liable to be proceeded against and punished accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a company as defined by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622), means— (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920 and L.N. 162 of 2013)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a director or secretary of the company; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a manager of the company, as defined by that section 2(1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a company incorporated outside Hong Kong or a specified body—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: means a director, secretary or manager of the company or specified body; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: includes any person who occupies the position of director, secretary or manager (by whatever name called) in the company or specified body.

section.name: s85
section.heading: Time limit for prosecution
section.content: Despite section 26 of the Magistrates Ordinance (Cap. 227), proceedings in respect of an offence under this Ordinance, other than an indictable offence, may be brought within 3 years after the commission of the offence.

section.name: s86
section.heading: Appointment of Authority

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may appoint a public officer to be the authority for the purposes of this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may appoint other public officers to assist the Authority in the performance of the Authority’s functions.

subsection.content: An appointment under subsection (1) is to be notified in the Gazette.

section.name: s87
section.heading: Functions of Authority
section.leadIn: The functions of the Authority are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to administer the provisions of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to supervise compliance with Parts 2, 3 and 4;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to educate the public on any matter relating to the provisions of this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to perform other functions conferred on the Authority by or under this Ordinance or any other enactment.

section.name: s88
section.heading: Authority may issue guidelines

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may issue guidelines—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: indicating the manner in which the Authority proposes to perform any function or exercise any power; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: providing guidance on the operation of any provision of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must publish the guidelines in a manner appropriate to bring them to the notice of persons affected by them; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must make copies of the guidelines available to the public (in hard copy form or electronic form).

subsection.content: Guidelines issued under this section are not subsidiary legislation.
The Authority may amend or revoke any of the guidelines. Subsections (2) and (3) apply to an amendment or revocation of guidelines in the same way as they apply to the guidelines.

subsection.leadIn: A person does not incur any civil or criminal liability only because the person has contravened any of the guidelines. However, if, in any legal proceedings, the court is satisfied that a guideline is relevant to determining a matter that is in issue—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the guideline is admissible in evidence in the proceedings; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: proof that the person contravened or did not contravene the guideline may be relied on by any party to the proceedings as tending to establish or negate the matter.

section.name: s89
section.heading: Electronic database for information about residential properties

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may establish and maintain an electronic database of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: information and statistics on the residential property market in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: information and statistics on any development situated in Hong Kong (other than a development that falls within section 10(3) or (5)).

subsection.content: The Authority may delegate, in writing, to a public officer, or any person whom the Authority thinks fit, the power given to the Authority under subsection (1).

section.name: s90
section.heading: Directions by Secretary for Housing

subsection.content: The Secretary may give directions to the Authority or a public officer appointed under section 86(1)(b), either generally or in a particular case, with respect to the performance of the functions, or the exercise of the powers, of the Authority or public officer (as the case may be).
If a direction is given to the Authority or a public officer under subsection (1), the Authority or public officer must comply with the direction.

section.name: s91
section.heading: Investigation powers for suspected contravention

subsection.content: If the Authority has reasonable cause to believe that a person may have contravened a provision of this Ordinance, the Authority, or a public officer appointed under section 86(1)(b), may exercise the powers under this section for the purpose of investigating the contravention or the question whether or not there has been such a contravention.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority or public officer may, in writing, require a person specified in subsection (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: to produce, within the time and at the place specified in the requirement, any record or document specified in the requirement—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that is or may be relevant to any matter under investigation; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that is in the person’s possession;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to attend before the Authority or officer at the time and place specified in the requirement, and answer any question relating to any matter under investigation that the Authority or officer may raise with the person;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to respond to any written question relating to any matter under investigation that the Authority or officer may raise with the person; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to give the Authority or officer any assistance in connection with the investigation that the person is reasonably able to give.

subsection.leadIn: The person specified for the purposes of subsection (2) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person whom the Authority has reasonable cause to believe may have contravened a provision of this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person whom the Authority or officer has reasonable cause to believe—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to be in possession of any record or document that contains, or that is likely to contain, information relevant to any matter under investigation; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to be otherwise in possession of such information.

subsection.content: If a person produces a record or document in compliance with a requirement imposed under subsection (2)(a), the Authority or officer may require the person to give an explanation or further particulars in respect of the record or document.

If a person gives any answer, response, explanation or particulars in compliance with a requirement imposed under subsection (2) or (4), the Authority or officer may, in writing, require the person to verify within the time specified in the requirement, the answer, response, explanation or particulars by a statutory declaration.

If, for the reason that the information concerned is not within the person’s knowledge or possession, a person does not give any answer, response, explanation or particulars in compliance with a requirement imposed under subsection (2) or (4), the Authority or officer may, in writing, require the person to verify, within the time specified in the requirement, that reason and fact by a statutory declaration.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority or a public officer appointed under section 86(1)(b) may not require an authorized institution to produce any record or document, or disclose any information, relating to the affairs of a customer of the institution under this section unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the customer is a person whom the Authority or public officer has reasonable cause to believe may be able to give information relevant to the investigation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Authority or public officer is satisfied, and certifies in writing that the Authority or officer is satisfied, that the production or disclosure is necessary for the purpose of the investigation.

subsection.content: The Authority or a public officer appointed under section 86(1)(b) may not require a person to produce any record or document, or disclose any information, that the person would on grounds of legal professional privilege be entitled to refuse to produce or disclose.

section.name: s92
section.heading: Offences relating to section 91

subsection.content: A person commits an offence if the person, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a specified requirement imposed on the person.
A person commits an offence if the person, with intent to defraud, fails to comply with a specified requirement imposed on the person.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in purported compliance with a specified requirement imposed on the person, the person produces any record or document, or gives an answer or response, or gives any explanation or particulars, that are false or misleading in a material respect; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person knows that, or is reckless as to whether, the record or document, or the answer or response, or the explanation or particulars, are false or misleading in a material respect.
