subsection.content: A person commits an offence if, in purported compliance with a specified requirement imposed on the person, the person, with intent to defraud, produces any record or document, or gives an answer or response, or gives any explanation or particulars, that are false or misleading in a material respect.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if, being an officer or employee of a corporation, the person, with intent to defraud—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: causes or allows the corporation to fail to comply with a specified requirement imposed on the corporation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: causes or allows the corporation, in purported compliance with a specified requirement imposed on the corporation, to produce any record or document, or give an answer or response, or give any explanation or particulars, that are false or misleading in a material respect.

subsection.content: A person is not excused from complying with a specified requirement imposed on the person only on the ground that to do so might tend to incriminate the person.
A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (2), (3), (4) or (5) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $5,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 3 years.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified requirement (指明要求) means a requirement imposed under section 91.

section.name: s93
section.heading: Confidentiality of matter or information obtained in investigation

subsection.content: Except in the performance of any function under this Ordinance, the Authority or a public officer appointed under section 86(1)(b) must maintain confidentiality in respect of any matter or information produced or given for the purpose of an investigation under section 91.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not prevent—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the disclosure of information that has already been made available to the public;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the disclosure of information for the purpose of any criminal proceedings in Hong Kong or an investigation conducted with a view to bringing any such proceedings;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the disclosure of information in connection with any judicial or other proceedings to which the Authority is a party; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the disclosure of information in accordance with an order of a court, magistrate or tribunal, or in accordance with a law or a requirement made under a law.

section.name: s94
section.heading: Use of incriminating evidence in proceedings

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority, or a public officer appointed under section 86(1)(b), requires a person to give an answer or response to any question, or to give an explanation or further particulars, under section 91, the Authority or officer must ensure that the person has first been informed or reminded of the limitations imposed by subsection (2) on the admissibility in evidence of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the requirement; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the question and the answer or response, or the explanation or particulars.

subsection.leadIn: Despite anything in this Part, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority, or a public officer appointed under section 86(1)(b), requires a person to give an answer or response to any question, or to give an explanation or further particulars, under section 91; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the answer or response, or the explanation or particulars, might tend to incriminate the person, and the person so claims before giving the answer or response or giving the explanation or particulars,

subsection.continued: the requirement, as well as the question and the answer or response, or the explanation or particulars, are not admissible in evidence against the person in criminal proceedings in a court of law other than those specified in subsection (3).

subsection.content: The criminal proceedings are those in which the person is charged with an offence under section 92(1), (2), (3), (4) or (5), or under Part V of the Crimes Ordinance (Cap. 200), or for perjury, in respect of the answer or response, or the explanation or particulars.

section.name: s95
section.heading: Amendment of Schedules
section.content: The Secretary may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7 or 8.

part.name: P1
part.heading: Detailed Requirements for Specific Information Required to be Set Out (See Section 19(2))

section.name: s1
section.heading: Information on the development

subsection.content: The sales brochure must set out the information specified in section 19(2)(a) in compliance with this section.

subsection.leadIn: The sales brochure must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the street at which the development is situated; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the street number allocated by the Commissioner of Rating and Valuation for the purpose of distinguishing the development.

subsection.leadIn: If the development consists of one or more multi-unit buildings, the sales brochure must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the total number of storeys of each multi-unit building;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the floor numbering in each multi-unit building as provided in the approved building plans for the development;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the omitted floor numbers in each multi-unit building in which the floor numbering is not in consecutive order; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the refuge floors (if any) of each multi-unit building.

subsection.leadIn: If the development consists of houses, the sales brochure must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the total number of houses;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the house numbering as provided in the approved building plans for the development; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: (where the house numbering is not in consecutive order) the omitted house numbers.

subsection.leadIn: If the development is an uncompleted development, the sales brochure—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must state the estimated material date for the development, as provided by the authorized person for the development;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must state that the estimated material date is subject to any extension of time that is permitted under the agreement for sale and purchase; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: must state that for the purpose of the agreement for sale and purchase—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where, under the land grant, the consent of the Director of Lands is required to be given for the sale and purchase, without limiting any other means by which the completion of the development may be proved, the issue of a certificate of compliance or consent to assign by the Director of Lands is conclusive evidence that the development has been completed or is deemed to be completed (as the case may be); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: where, under the land grant, the consent of the Director of Lands is not required to be given for the sale and purchase—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: in the case of a specified NT development, the development is deemed to be completed on the date on which a letter is issued by the Director of Lands confirming that the Director of Lands has no objection to every building in the development being occupied; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: in any other case, the development is deemed to be completed on the date on which an occupation permit for every building in the development is issued.

subsection.leadIn: If the development is a completed development pending compliance, the sales brochure—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must state the estimated material date for the development, as provided by the authorized person for the development;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must state that the estimated material date is subject to any extension of time that is permitted under the agreement for sale and purchase; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must state that for the purpose of the agreement for sale and purchase, without limiting any other means by which the completion of the development may be proved, the issue of a certificate of compliance or consent to assign by the Director of Lands is conclusive evidence that the development has been completed or is deemed to be completed (as the case may be).

section.name: s2
section.heading: Information on vendor and others involved in the development

subsection.content: The sales brochure must set out the information specified in section 19(2)(b) in compliance with this section.

subsection.leadIn: The sales brochure must state the names of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the vendor, and if a vendor is a corporation, every holding company of that vendor;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the authorized person for the development, and the firm or corporation of which an authorized person for the development is a proprietor, director or employee in his or her professional capacity;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the building contractor for the development;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the firm of solicitors acting for the owner in relation to the sale of residential properties in the development;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any authorized institution that has made a loan, or has undertaken to provide finance, for the construction of the development;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any other person who has made a loan for the construction of the development.

subsection.leadIn: The sales brochure must, in the case of a specified NT development, state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the period for which the authorized person for the development is appointed to supervise the construction of the development; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the period for which the building contractor for the development is appointed to construct the development.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Relationship between parties involved in the development

subsection.content: The sales brochure must set out the information specified in section 19(2)(c) in compliance with this section.

subsection.leadIn: The sales brochure must state each of the following facts (if they exist)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the vendor or a building contractor for the development is an individual, and that vendor or contractor is an immediate family member of an authorized person for the development;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the vendor or a building contractor for the development is a partnership, and a partner of that vendor or contractor is an immediate family member of such an authorized person;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the vendor or a building contractor for the development is a corporation, and a director or the secretary of that vendor or contractor (or a holding company of that vendor) is an immediate family member of such an authorized person;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the vendor or a building contractor for the development is an individual, and that vendor or contractor is an immediate family member of an associate of such an authorized person;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the vendor or a building contractor for the development is a partnership, and a partner of that vendor or contractor is an immediate family member of an associate of such an authorized person;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the vendor or a building contractor for the development is a corporation, and a director or the secretary of that vendor or contractor (or a holding company of that vendor) is an immediate family member of an associate of such an authorized person;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the vendor or a building contractor for the development is an individual, and that vendor or contractor is an immediate family member of a proprietor of a firm of solicitors acting for the owner in relation to the sale of residential properties in the development;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the vendor or a building contractor for the development is a partnership, and a partner of that vendor or contractor is an immediate family member of a proprietor of a firm of solicitors acting for the owner in relation to the sale of residential properties in the development;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the vendor or a building contractor for the development is a corporation, and a director or the secretary of that vendor or contractor (or a holding company of that vendor) is an immediate family member of a proprietor of such a firm of solicitors.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the sales brochure must also—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of subsection (2)(a), (b), (c), (d), (e) or (f) , state the name of the authorized person; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of subsection (2)(g), (h) or (i), state the name of the firm of solicitors;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the sales brochure is not required to state whether the authorized person, associate or proprietor is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a spouse;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a parent;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a child;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: a sibling;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: a grandparent; or

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: a grandchild,

paragraph.continued: of the vendor, contractor, partner, director or secretary; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the sales brochure is not required, in the case of subsection (2)(c), (f) or (i), to state the name of the director or secretary.

subsection.leadIn: The sales brochure must state each of the following facts (if they exist)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the vendor, a holding company of the vendor, or a building contractor for the development, is a private company, and an authorized person for the development, or an associate of such an authorized person, holds at least 10% of the issued shares in that vendor, holding company or contractor;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the vendor, a holding company of the vendor, or a building contractor for the development, is a listed company, and such an authorized person, or such an associate, holds at least 1% of the issued shares in that vendor, holding company or contractor;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the vendor or a building contractor for the development is a corporation, and such an authorized person, or such an associate, is an employee, director or secretary of that vendor or contractor or of a holding company of that vendor;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the vendor or a building contractor for the development is a partnership, and such an authorized person, or such an associate, is an employee of that vendor or contractor;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the vendor, a holding company of the vendor, or a building contractor for the development, is a private company, and a proprietor of a firm of solicitors acting for the owner in relation to the sale of residential properties in the development holds at least 10% of the issued shares in that vendor, holding company or contractor;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the vendor, a holding company of the vendor, or a building contractor for the development, is a listed company, and a proprietor of such a firm of solicitors holds at least 1% of the issued shares in that vendor, holding company or contractor;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the vendor or a building contractor for the development is a corporation, and a proprietor of such a firm of solicitors is an employee, director or secretary of that vendor or contractor or of a holding company of that vendor;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the vendor or a building contractor for the development is a partnership, and a proprietor of such a firm of solicitors is an employee of that vendor or contractor;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the vendor or a building contractor for the development is a corporation, and the corporation of which an authorized person for the development is a director or employee in his or her professional capacity is an associate corporation of that vendor or contractor or of a holding company of that vendor;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: the vendor or a building contractor for the development is a corporation, and that contractor is an associate corporation of that vendor or of a holding company of that vendor.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (4)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the sales brochure must also—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of subsection (4)(a), (b), (c) or (d), state the name of the authorized person; or

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the sales brochure is not required, in the case of subsection (4)(a), (b), (e) or (f), to state the percentage or amount of share holding.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: Associate
def.leadIn: associate (有聯繫人士), in relation to an authorized person, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a proprietor of the firm of which the authorized person is a proprietor in his or her professional capacity; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a director of the corporation of which the authorized person is a director in his or her professional capacity;

subsection.def: listed company (上市公司) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920 and L.N. 162 of 2013)
private company (私人公司) has the meaning given by section 11 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622). (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920 and L.N. 162 of 2013)

section.name: s4
section.heading: Information on design of the development

subsection.content: The sales brochure must set out the information specified in section 19(2)(d) in compliance with this section.

subsection.leadIn: The sales brochure must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a completed development, whether there are any non-structural prefabricated external walls, or any curtain walls, forming part of the enclosing walls; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for an uncompleted development, whether there will be any such non-structural prefabricated external walls or curtain walls.

subsection.leadIn: If there are or will be (as applicable) non-structural prefabricated external walls forming part of the enclosing walls, the sales brochure must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the range of thickness of the non-structural prefabricated external walls of each block; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the total area of the non-structural prefabricated external walls of each residential property.

subsection.leadIn: If there are or will be (as applicable) curtain walls forming part of the enclosing walls, the sales brochure must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the range of thickness of the curtain walls of each building; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the total area of the curtain walls of each residential property.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Information on property management

subsection.content: The sales brochure must set out the information specified in section 19(2)(e) in compliance with this section.

subsection.leadIn: The sales brochure must state the identity of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for an uncompleted development, the person appointed as the manager of the development under the latest draft deed of mutual covenant; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for a completed development, the person appointed as the manager of the development under—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the deed of mutual covenant that has been executed; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the latest draft deed of mutual covenant as at the date on which the sales brochure is printed.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Location plan of the development

subsection.content: The sales brochure must set out the information specified in section 19(2)(f) in compliance with this section.

subsection.leadIn: The location plan—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: must be at least 16 centimetres in length and 16 centimetres in width—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: with the size of the letters or numbers of the legends in English for that plan not smaller than the size of the same letters or numbers in 10 point Times New Roman typeface; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: with the size of the characters or numbers of the legends in Chinese for that plan not smaller than the size of the same characters or numbers in 10 point “新細明體” typeface; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must show—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the location of the development;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the name of every street that is situated within 250 metres from the boundary of the development; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: every building, facility or structure (if any) specified in subsection (4) that is situated within 250 metres from the boundary of the development.

subsection.content: The location plan must have the scale to which it is drawn marked on that plan.

subsection.leadIn: The building, facility or structure is one the principal use of which is the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a crematorium;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a columbarium;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a mortuary;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a slaughterhouse;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a bus depot;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a railway depot;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: a ventilation shaft for the Mass Transit Railway;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: a library;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: a museum;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: a barrack;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: a cargo working area;

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.content: a petrol filling station;

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: a LPG filling station;

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.content: an oil depot;

paragraph.name: o
paragraph.content: an aviation fuel depot;

paragraph.name: p
paragraph.content: a marine fuel depot;

paragraph.name: q
paragraph.content: sewage treatment works and facilities;

paragraph.name: r
paragraph.content: landfills (including ex-landfills);

paragraph.name: s
paragraph.content: a landfill gas flaring plant;

paragraph.name: t
paragraph.content: a power plant (including electricity sub-stations);

paragraph.name: u
paragraph.content: a pylon;

paragraph.name: v
paragraph.content: a correctional institution (including a prison);

paragraph.name: w
paragraph.content: an addiction treatment centre;

paragraph.name: x
paragraph.content: a helicopter landing pad;

paragraph.name: y
paragraph.content: a clinic;

paragraph.name: z
paragraph.content: a fire station;

paragraph.name: za
paragraph.content: an ambulance depot;

paragraph.name: zb
paragraph.content: a funeral parlour;

paragraph.name: zc
paragraph.content: a cemetery;

paragraph.name: zd
paragraph.content: judicial facilities (including a court and a magistracy);

paragraph.name: ze
paragraph.content: a refuse collection point;

paragraph.name: zf
paragraph.content: a hospital;

paragraph.name: zg
paragraph.content: a market (including a wet market and a wholesale market);

paragraph.name: zh
paragraph.content: a police station;

paragraph.name: zi
paragraph.content: a public carpark (including a lorry park);

paragraph.name: zj
paragraph.content: a public convenience;

paragraph.name: zk
paragraph.content: a public transport terminal (including a rail station);

paragraph.name: zl
paragraph.content: a public utility installation;

paragraph.name: zm
zn
paragraph.content: a school (including a kindergarten);

paragraph.name: zo
paragraph.content: social welfare facilities (including an elderly centre and a home for the mentally disabled);

paragraph.name: zp
paragraph.content: sports facilities (including a sports ground and a swimming pool);

paragraph.name: zq
paragraph.content: a public park.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Aerial photograph of the development

subsection.content: The sales brochure must set out the information specified in section 19(2)(g) in compliance with this section.

The aerial photograph of the development must be the latest one as at the date on which the sales brochure is printed, as taken by the Survey and Mapping Office of the Lands Department at a flying height below 7 000 feet.

subsection.leadIn: The aerial photograph of the development—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be at least 16 centimetres in length and 16 centimetres in width; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must show the development and the surrounding area within 250 metres from the boundary of the development.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Outline zoning plan etc. relating to the development

subsection.content: The sales brochure must set out the information specified in section 19(2)(h) in compliance with this section.

subsection.leadIn: The outline zoning plan or development permission area plan, or the plan deemed to be a draft plan—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: must be at least 16 centimetres in length and 16 centimetres in width—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: with the size of the letters or numbers of the legends in English for that plan not smaller than the size of the same letters or numbers in 10 point Times New Roman typeface; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: with the size of the characters or numbers of the legends in Chinese for that plan not smaller than the size of the same characters or numbers in 10 point “新細明體” typeface; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must show the existing and proposed uses of all land situated within 500 metres from the boundary of the development.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Layout plan of the development

subsection.content: The sales brochure must set out the information specified in section 19(2)(i) in compliance with this section.

subsection.leadIn: The layout plan—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must have the scale to which it is drawn marked on that plan;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must show the location and layouts of the buildings, the open areas, the facilities, and the undeveloped land (with the intended use), within the boundary of the development; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if any of the buildings or facilities are not yet completed, must state the estimated date of completion of these buildings or facilities, as provided by the authorized person for the development.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Floor plans of residential properties in the development

subsection.content: The sales brochure must set out the information specified in section 19(2)(j) in compliance with this section.

subsection.leadIn: Each of the floor plans of the residential properties in the development—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be drawn to a scale of at least 1:200 and has that scale marked on the plan;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must show the dimensions of the furniture (if any) shown on the plan;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: must state the following as provided in the approved building plans for the development—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the thickness of the floor slabs (excluding plaster) of each residential property;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the floor-to-floor height of each residential property;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: must state the following—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the external dimensions of each residential property;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the internal dimensions of each residential property;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the thickness of the internal partitions of each residential property;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the external dimensions of individual compartments in each residential property; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: must state that the internal areas of the residential properties on the upper floors will generally be slightly larger than those on the lower floors because of the reducing thickness of the structural walls on the upper floors.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (2)(d), if any information required by that subsection is provided in the approved building plans for the development, a floor plan must state the information as so provided.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Area of residential properties in the development

subsection.content: The sales brochure must set out the information specified in section 19(2)(k) in compliance with this section.

subsection.leadIn: The sales brochure must set out the following information in relation to each residential property in the development in the form specified by the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the saleable area of the residential property;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the floor area of every one of the following to the extent that it forms part of the residential property—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a balcony;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a utility platform;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a verandah;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the area of every one of the items specified in Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the extent that it forms part of the residential property.

subsection.leadIn: The sales brochure must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the saleable area under subsection (2)(a), and the floor area under subsection (2)(b), are calculated in accordance with section 8; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the area under subsection (2)(c) is calculated in accordance with Part 2 of Schedule 2.

subsection.content: An area under subsection (2) must be set out in square feet and in square metres.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Floor plans of parking spaces in the development

subsection.content: The sales brochure must set out the information specified in section 19(2)(l) in compliance with this section.

subsection.leadIn: Each of the floor plans of the parking spaces in the development—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must show the location of the parking spaces;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must state the number of the parking spaces; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must state the dimensions and area of each of the parking spaces.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Summary of preliminary agreement for sale and purchase

subsection.content: The sales brochure must set out the information specified in section 19(2)(m) in compliance with this section.

subsection.leadIn: The sales brochure must contain a summary of the provisions of the preliminary agreement for sale and purchase that deal with the following matters—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that a preliminary deposit of 5% is payable on the signing of that preliminary agreement;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the preliminary deposit paid by the purchaser on the signing of that preliminary agreement will be held by a firm of solicitors acting for the owner, as stakeholders;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: that if the purchaser fails to execute the agreement for sale and purchase within 5 working days after the date on which the purchaser enters into that preliminary agreement—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that preliminary agreement is terminated;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the preliminary deposit is forfeited; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the owner does not have any further claim against the purchaser for the failure.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Summary of deed of mutual covenant

subsection.content: The sales brochure must set out the information specified in section 19(2)(n) in compliance with this section.

subsection.leadIn: The sales brochure must contain a summary of the provisions of the draft deed of mutual covenant or the deed of mutual covenant, as applicable, that deal with the following matters—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the common parts of the development;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the number of undivided shares assigned to each residential property in the development;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the term of years for which the manager of the development is appointed;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the basis on which the management expenses are shared among the owners of the residential properties in the development;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the basis on which the management fee deposit is fixed;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the area (if any) in the development retained by the owner for that owner’s own use.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Summary of land grant

subsection.content: The sales brochure must set out the information specified in section 19(2)(o) in compliance with this section.

subsection.leadIn: The sales brochure must contain a summary of the provisions of the land grant concerning the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the lot number of the land on which the development is situated;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the term of years under the lease;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the user restrictions applicable to that land;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the facilities that are required to be constructed and provided for the Government, or for public use;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the grantee’s obligations to lay, form or landscape any areas, or to construct or maintain any structures or facilities, within or outside that land;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the lease conditions that are onerous to a purchaser.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Information on public facilities and public open spaces

subsection.content: The sales brochure must set out the information specified in section 19(2)(p) in compliance with this section.

subsection.leadIn: The sales brochure—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must contain a description of any facilities that are required under the land grant to be constructed and provided for the Government, or for public use;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must contain a description of any facilities that are required under the land grant to be managed, operated or maintained for public use at the expense of the owners of the residential properties in the development;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must set out the size of any open space that is required under the land grant to be managed, operated or maintained for public use at the expense of the owners of the residential properties in the development; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: must contain a description of any part of the land (on which the development is situated) that is dedicated to the public for the purposes of regulation 22(1) of the Building (Planning) Regulations (Cap. 123 sub. leg. F).

subsection.leadIn: The sales brochure must set out a plan—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that shows the location of those facilities and open spaces, and those parts of the land, mentioned in subsection (2) as far as it is practicable to do so; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that has those facilities and open spaces, and those parts of the land, coloured or shaded in the same colour, format or pattern (as applicable) as in the land grant or the deed of dedication (as the case may be).

subsection.content: The sales brochure must, in relation to any of those facilities and open spaces, and those parts of the land, mentioned in subsection (2) that are for public use, state that the general public has the right to use the facilities or open spaces, or the parts of the land, in accordance with the land grant or the deed of dedication (as the case may be).

subsection.leadIn: The sales brochure must, in relation to any of those facilities and open spaces mentioned in subsection (2)(b) or (c), state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the facilities or open spaces are required to be managed, operated or maintained at the expense of the owners of the residential properties in the development; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that those owners are required to meet a proportion of the expense of managing, operating or maintaining the facilities or open spaces through the management expenses apportioned to the residential properties concerned.

subsection.content: The sales brochure must set out the provisions of the land grant and the deed of dedication, and of every deed of mutual covenant in respect of the specified residential property, that concern those facilities and open spaces, and those parts of the land, mentioned in subsection (2).

part.name: P2
part.heading:
Additional Information Required to be Set Out
(See Section 19(3))

section.name: s17
section.heading: Warning to purchasers

subsection.content: The sales brochure must recommend the purchaser to instruct a separate firm of solicitors (other than that acting for the owner) to act for the purchaser in relation to the transaction.

subsection.leadIn: The sales brochure must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that if the purchaser instructs such separate firm of solicitors to act for the purchaser in relation to the transaction, that firm will be able to give independent advice to the purchaser;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that if the purchaser instructs the firm of solicitors acting for the owner to act for the purchaser as well, and a conflict of interest arises between the owner and the purchaser—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that firm may not be able to protect the purchaser’s interests; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the purchaser may have to instruct a separate firm of solicitors; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that in the case of paragraph (b)(ii), the total solicitors’ fees payable by the purchaser may be higher than the fees that would have been payable if the purchaser had instructed a separate firm of solicitors in the first place.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Cross-section plan of building in the development
section.leadIn: The sales brochure must, in relation to every building in the development, set out a plan showing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a cross-section of the building in relation to every street adjacent to the building; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the level of every such street in relation to a known datum and to the level of the lowest residential floor of the building.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Elevation plan

subsection.content: The sales brochure must set out a plan showing all elevations of the development.
The plan showing the elevations must be in colour.

subsection.leadIn: The plan showing the elevations must be certified by the authorized person for the development that the elevations—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: are prepared on the basis of the approved building plans for the development as of a date specified by the authorized person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: are in general accordance with the outward appearance of the development.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Information on common facilities in the development

subsection.leadIn: The sales brochure must set out the area, in both square feet and square metres, of every one of the following (if any)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a residents’ clubhouse (including any recreational facilities for residents’ use);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a communal garden or play area for residents’ use on the roof, or on any floor between the roof and the lowest residential floor, of a building in the development (whether known as a communal sky garden or otherwise);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a communal garden or play area for residents’ use below the lowest residential floor of a building in the development (whether known as a covered and landscaped play area or otherwise).

subsection.content: The sales brochure must state whether or not every one of the facilities specified in subsection (1)(a), (b) and (c) is covered.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Inspection of plans and deed of mutual covenant

subsection.content: The sales brochure must state the address of the website on which a copy of a plan specified in section 19(2)(h)(i) or (ii) relating to the development is available.

subsection.leadIn: The sales brochure must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that a copy of the following is available for inspection at the place at which the specified residential property is offered to be sold—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for an uncompleted development, the latest draft of every deed of mutual covenant in respect of the specified residential property as at the date on which the specified residential property is offered to be sold; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: for a completed development, either or both of the following as applicable—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: every deed of mutual covenant in respect of the specified residential property that has been executed;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the latest draft of every deed of mutual covenant in respect of the specified residential property as at the date on which the specified residential property is offered to be sold; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the inspection is free of charge.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Fittings, finishes and appliances

subsection.content: The sales brochure must, in relation to each item in the development specified in column 1 of the following table, set out the description specified opposite to it in column 2 of the table.

The sales brochure must, in relation to items 4(a) and 6 in the development specified in the following table, contain an undertaking by the vendor that if lifts or appliances of the specified brand name or model number are not installed in the development, lifts or appliances of comparable quality will be installed.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Service agreements
section.content: The sales brochure must set out information on any agreement with a utility company for providing utility service for the specified residential property.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Government rent
section.content: The sales brochure must state the date up to which the owner is liable for the Government rent payable for the specified residential property.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Miscellaneous payments by purchaser

subsection.leadIn: The sales brochure—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must state that, on the delivery of the vacant possession of the specified residential property to the purchaser, the purchaser is liable to reimburse the owner for the deposits for water, electricity and gas; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must state whether, on that delivery, the purchaser is also liable to pay to the owner a debris removal fee.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) applies even though the amount of the deposits or fee is yet to be ascertained at the date on which the sales brochure is printed.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Defect liability warranty period
section.content: The sales brochure must state the duration of the period during which the vendor is liable to make good any defect in the specified residential property, as provided in the agreement for sale and purchase.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Maintenance of slopes

subsection.leadIn: If the land grant requires the owners of the residential properties in the development to maintain any slope at their own cost, the sales brochure—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must state the terms of the requirement;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must state that each of the owners is obliged to contribute towards the costs of the maintenance work;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: must set out a plan showing—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the slope; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any retaining wall or related structures constructed, or to be constructed, within or outside the land on which the development is situated; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: must comply with subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: If the owner has undertaken to maintain any slope in relation to the development at that owner’s own cost, the sales brochure—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must state the terms of the undertaking; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must set out a plan showing—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the slope; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any retaining wall or related structures constructed, or to be constructed, within or outside the land on which the development is situated.

subsection.content: If, under the deed of mutual covenant, the manager of the development has the owners’ authority to carry out the maintenance work, the sales brochure must state this fact.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Modification
section.leadIn: If the owner has applied to the Government for a modification of the land grant, and the application is not yet granted, the sales brochure must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the nature of the modification sought; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the condition sought to be modified.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Information in application for concession on gross floor area of building

subsection.content: In setting out the information specified in section 21(1), the sales brochure must comply with this section.

subsection.leadIn: The sales brochure must set out—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: information on those areas in relation to which the power is exercised or the permission is given;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the environmental assessment of the building; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: information on the estimated energy performance or consumption for the common parts of the development.

subsection.statutoryNote:
Note—
The Authority is empowered under section 88 to issue guidelines providing guidance on the operation of this section.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Previous aerial photograph

subsection.content: The sales brochure may, in addition to the latest aerial photograph of the development specified in section 19(2)(g), set out any previous aerial photograph of the development.
In setting out any previous aerial photograph of the development under subsection (1), the sales brochure must comply with subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: The sales brochure—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must set out any previous aerial photograph of the development in that part of the sales brochure that sets out the latest aerial photograph of the development specified in section 19(2)(g); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must do so in compliance with section 7 of this Schedule as if the reference in that section to an aerial photograph of the development were a reference to the previous aerial photograph of the development.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Other common facilities

subsection.content: The sales brochure may, in addition to the information on the common facilities specified in section 20 of this Schedule, set out the information on any other facilities or area for common use.
In setting out the information, the sales brochure must comply with subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: The sales brochure—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must set out the information in that part of the sales brochure that sets out the information on the common facilities specified in section 20 of this Schedule; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must do so in compliance with that section as if the reference in that section to those common facilities were a reference to those other facilities and area for common use.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Application of this Schedule in case of phased development

subsection.leadIn: If the development is divided into 2 or more phases, Parts 1, 2, 3 and 4 of this Schedule apply to the sales brochure for the phase of which the specified residential property forms part as if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference in those Parts to an uncompleted development were a reference to an uncompleted phase;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference in those Parts to a completed development were a reference to a completed phase;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a reference in those Parts to a completed development pending compliance were a reference to a completed phase pending compliance; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (2), a reference in those Parts to the development were a reference to the phase of which the specified residential property forms part.

subsection.content: Subsection (1)(d) does not apply to a reference in sections 6, 8 and 9 of this Schedule to the development.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Application of this Schedule in case of specified NT development
section.leadIn: If the development is a specified NT development—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Part 1 of this Schedule applies as if the reference in sections 1(3)(b) and (4)(b) and 10(2)(c) of this Schedule to “as provided in the approved building plans for the development” were deleted; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Part 2 of this Schedule applies as if section 19(3)(a) of this Schedule were deleted.

section.name: s12
section.text: For the purposes of clause 11, the following is the “Warning to Purchasers”—

subsection.name: a
subsection.content:
Before you execute the formal agreement for sale and purchase which you have to sign if you go on with your purchase you should instruct a solicitor to protect your interests and to ensure that your purchase is properly completed.
如你繼續進行購買本物業，你便須簽署正式買賣合約，在你簽立正式買賣合約之前，你應聘用律師，以保障你的權益，和確保妥善完成購買本物業。

section.name: s6

section.name: s7
section.content: 除第8條另有規定外，如賣方於第4(c)條指明的日期(如獲認可人士根據第10條批予延期，則於經延展的日期)或之前未能完成θ本期╱本發展項目，則買方除任何其他可用的補救方法外，可藉向賣方發出書面通知，撤銷本合約，而該通知一經送達，本合約即告撤銷。賣方須於撤銷後的7日內，將買方根據本合約支付的所有款項，連同該等款項的利息，退還買方。利息由個別支付日期起計，直至退款日期為止，按香港上海滙豐銀行有限公司不時指明的最優惠利率加年利率2%計算。上述款項連同利息一經退還，即完全並最終解決買方在本合約之下對賣方的所有申索。

section.name: s8
section.content: 如買方不在第4(c)條指明的日期或第10條所指的任何經延展的日期後的28日內，根據第7條撤銷本合約，則在不削弱買方在第9條下的權利的情況下，買方即當作已選擇等待θ本期╱本發展項目完成。在此情況下，賣方須向買方支付買方根據本合約支付的所有款項的利息，利息由第4(c)條指明的日期翌日或第10條所指的任何經延展的日期翌日起計，直至θ本期╱本發展項目完成的日期為止，按香港上海滙豐銀行有限公司不時指明的最優惠利率加年利率2%計算。該利息須於買賣完成時向買方支付，或容許買方作售價的抵免。

section.content: 即使有第7及8條的規定，如θ本期╱本發展項目未能在第4(c)條指明的日期或第10條所指的任何經延展的日期起計的6個月內完成，則買方可撤銷本合約，而在該情況下，第7條中關於退還付款及利息的條文適用；買方亦可等待θ本期╱本發展項目完成，而在該情況下，第8條中關於支付利息的條文適用。

section.content: Subject to clause 6, if the Vendor fails to complete the θPhase/Development by the date specified in clause 4(c) as extended by any extensions of time granted by the Authorized Person under clause 8, the Purchaser is at liberty, in addition to any other remedy that the Purchaser may have, by notice in writing to the Vendor to rescind this Agreement and upon service of such notice, this Agreement is rescinded, and the Vendor shall, within 7 days after the rescission, repay to the Purchaser all amounts paid by the Purchaser under this Agreement together with interest on those amounts at the rate of 2% per annum above the prime rate specified by The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited from time to time from the date or dates on which such amounts were paid up to the date of repayment, the repayment of such amounts and interest to be in full and final settlement of all claims by the Purchaser against the Vendor under this Agreement.

section.content: If the Purchaser does not rescind this Agreement under clause 5 within 28 days after the date specified in clause 4(c) or any extended date under clause 8, the Purchaser is deemed, without prejudice to the Purchaser’s rights under clause 7, to have elected to wait for completion of the θPhase/Development. Such interest shall be paid or allowed as a credit to the Purchaser in respect of the purchase price on completion of the sale and purchase.

section.name: s7
section.content: Despite clauses 5 and 6, if the θPhase/Development is not completed within a period of 6 months from the date specified in clause 4(c) or any extended date under clause 8, the Purchaser is at liberty either to rescind this Agreement in which event the provisions of clause 5 relating to repayment and interest apply or to await the completion of the θPhase/Development in which event the provisions of clause 6 relating to the payment of interest apply.

section.content: 除第6條另有規定外，如賣方於第4(c)條指明的日期(如獲認可人士根據第8條批予延期，則於經延展的日期)或之前未能完成θ本期╱本發展項目，則買方除任何其他可用的補救方法外，可藉向賣方發出書面通知，撤銷本合約，而該通知一經送達，本合約即告撤銷。賣方須於撤銷後的7日內，將買方根據本合約支付的所有款項，連同該等款項的利息，退還買方。利息由個別支付日期起計，直至退款日期為止，按香港上海滙豐銀行有限公司不時指明的最優惠利率加年利率2%計算。上述款項連同利息一經退還，即完全並最終解決買方在本合約之下對賣方的所有申索。

section.name: s6
section.content: 如買方不在第4(c)條指明的日期或第8條所指的任何經延展的日期後的28日內，根據第5條撤銷本合約，則在不削弱買方在第7條下的權利的情況下，買方即當作已選擇等待θ本期╱本發展項目完成。在此情況下，賣方須向買方支付買方根據本合約支付的所有款項的利息，利息由第4(c)條指明的日期翌日或第8條所指的任何經延展的日期翌日起計，直至θ本期╱本發展項目完成的日期為止，按香港上海滙豐銀行有限公司不時指明的最優惠利率加年利率2%計算。該利息須於買賣完成時向買方支付，或容許買方作售價的抵免。

section.name: s7
section.content: 即使有第5及6條的規定，如θ本期╱本發展項目未能在第4(c)條指明的日期或第8條所指的任何經延展的日期起計的6個月內完成，則買方可撤銷本合約，而在該情況下，第5條中關於退還付款及利息的條文適用；買方亦可等待θ本期╱本發展項目完成，而在該情況下，第6條中關於支付利息的條文適用。

section.name: s8

subsection.content: 戰爭；或

section.content: 賣方須於認可人士根據第8條批予延期後的14日內，向買方提供有關延期證明書的文本。

section.content: 如賣方在本物業的權益屬衡平法權益而非法定產業權，買方不得提出反對。

section.name: s19

section.content: 就每一方面而言，時間為本合約的關鍵元素。

subsection.content: 第一，不時向賣方發放經認可人士證明為用於建造γ本期╱本發展項目已支用或須支付的款額，以支付建築費用及專業費用；

subsection.name: c
subsection.content: 第三，如賣方律師及在γ本期╱本發展項目的住宅單位的買賣中代表賣方行事的所有其他律師(如有的話)作為保證金保存人在任何時間所持的款項，足以支付不時經認可人士證明的建築費用及專業費用全部尚欠的餘額及上文(b)款所提述的其他款項，則用於支付以建築按揭(如有的話)為保證的任何其他款項；及

section.content: 凡本物業或第28條所列出的裝置、裝修物料或設備有欠妥之處，而該欠妥之處並非由買方行為或疏忽造成，則賣方在接獲買方在第13條所指的買賣成交日期後的6個月內送達的書面通知後，須於合理地切實可行的範圍內，盡快自費作出補救。本條的規定並不削弱買方按普通法或其他法律可享有的任何其他權利或補救。

section.name: s24
section.content: 賣方向買方承諾，如有關乎或影響本物業或本發展項目的公用地方或公用部分及公用設施的欠妥之處，則在該欠妥之處有此關連或影響的範圍內，賣方將盡力執行在所有與本發展項目的建造有關的合約下的關於該等欠妥之處及維修的所有責任。

section.content: If any date stipulated for payment in this Agreement or the day on which completion of the sale and purchase is to take place as provided in this Agreement falls on a day that is not a business day or on a day on which Typhoon Signal No. 8 or above is hoisted or Black Rainstorm Warning Signal is issued at any time between the hours of 9 a.m. and 5 p.m., such date for payment or completion of the sale and purchase is automatically postponed to the immediately following day that is a business day and on which no Typhoon Signal No. 8 or above is hoisted or Black Rainstorm Warning Signal is issued at any time between the hours of 9 a.m. and 5 p.m.

section.name: s14
section.content: 凡本物業或第19條所列出的裝置、裝修物料或設備有欠妥之處，而該欠妥之處並非由買方行為或疏忽造成，則賣方在接獲買方在第4條所指的買賣成交日期後的6個月內送達的書面通知後，須於合理地切實可行的範圍內，盡快自費作出補救。本條的規定，並不削弱買方按普通法或其他法律可享有的任何其他權利或補救。

section.name: s15
section.content: 賣方向買方承諾，如有關乎或影響本物業或本發展項目的公用地方或公用部分及公用設施的欠妥之處，則在該欠妥之處有此關連或影響的範圍內，賣方將盡力執行在所有與本發展項目的建造有關的合約下的關於該等欠妥之處及維修的所有責任。

section.name: s16
section.content: 如賣方清盤(不論是否自發清盤)或解散，在所有關乎本發展項目的建造的合約下的所有保證條款及擔保的利益及權利，須由賣方轉讓予根據《建築物管理條例》(第344章)成立的業主立案法團；如沒有該法團存在，則須轉讓予本發展項目當其時的管理人，以信託形式，代買方及本發展項目所有其他單位的購樓人士持有。

section.name: s17
section.content: 在以轉讓契完成買賣後，第6、14、15及16條維持有效。

section.name: s18
section.content: 如任何本合約指定的付款日期或按本合約規定完成買賣的日期並非辦公日，或在上午9時至下午5時之間，懸掛8號或以上颱風訊號或發出黑色暴雨警告訊號，則該付款日期或完成買賣日期自動順延至下一個緊接該日並在上午9時至下午5時之間沒有懸掛8號或以上颱風訊號或發出黑色暴雨警告訊號的辦公日。

section.name: s2
section.heading: Application of section 1 of this Schedule in case of phased development
section.content: If the development is divided into 2 or more phases, section 1 of this Schedule applies to the vendor’s information form as if a reference in section 1(d), (e) and (f) of this Schedule to the development were a reference to the phase of which the specified residential property forms part.
